content: here is a link to a video showing this technique yarn requirements one strand dk weight yarn this can be substituted for two strands of we also use the backwards loop increase for fingering weight yarn if you want to fade or marl increasing the neckline and for creating armpit your colours whatever you choose to use stitches here is a link to a video showing this please ensure you swatch to ensure the correct technique gauge can be achieved abbreviations yarn used as shown in main picture tiny teal handcrafted 100% merino dk 225m per 100g in k knit urban graffiti and coal colourways p purl mc main colour the estimated meterage is calculated as the cc contrast colour pattern is written you can easily change the kfb a neutral increase which leaves a purl length of the body or sleeves to suit your bump to the left of the increase stitch personal style however please be aware that backwards loop a neutral increase this may increase the amount of yarn needed mds make double stitch during short row pm place marker total meterage / yardage required sm slip marker rm remove marker xx xx xx xx xx meters bor beginning of round wr wrong side xx xx xx xx xx yards rs right side the colour block boxy tee - victoria lewis - tiny teal handcrafted - copyright 2021 7 junior pattern yoke set up using cc or your chosen ribbing colour and cast on 72 72 80 80 88 stitches on smaller ribbing needles join in the round and place a marker for the beginning of the round bor work 4 4 6 6 6 rounds in single rib *k1 p1* around your ribbing should measure approximately 0 7 / 1 75cm for sizes 2-4 and 4-6 all other sizes your ribbing should measure approximately 1 / 2 5cm change to larger main needles knit the next round in the same colour as your ribbing break cc and introduce your mc knit all stitches placing markers as follows k14 14 16 16 17 pm k7 7 7 7 9 pm k29 29 33 33 35 pm k7 7 7 7 9 pm k to bor yoke increases **this is the perfect time to try on your sweater row 1 increase round *k to 1 stitch before every body is different and trying on at this marker kfb sm kfb* repeat 3 more times k to point is your first opportunity to really bor customise the finished sweater to better fit your own wonderful body the given yoke depth row 2 knit all stitches no increases measurements are a really good suggestion but they are not set in stone i highly recommend repeat these two row 12 13 13 15 17 more that you try on your sweater before going any times further if you try on your sweater at this point and you are happy with the fit do a little dance each increase round increases stitch
